class.name: LuaScript
class.brief_description: A [Script] written in the Lua language.

method.name: new
method.description: Returns a new instance of the script. [codeblocks] [gdscript] # lua_script.lua: # ```lua # local obj = {} # obj.attack_point = 20 # obj.life_point = 100 # function obj:add_life(value) # self.life_point = self.life_point + value # end # return obj # ``` var lua_script = load("lua_script.lua") var instance = lua_script.new() print(instance.attack_point) # Prints 20 instance.add_life(10) print(instance.get("life_point")) # Prints 110 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

members.member: See [enum ImportBehavior] for more information about each behavior. Changes to this property in the Inspector changes an internal setting in the [code]project.godot[/code].

Read-only property that marks whether this script's source code looks like a Godot script. Lua code that looks like a Godot script are those that end by returning a variable ([code]return YourClassVariableHere[/code]) or a table constructed inline ([code]return {...}[/code]).

constants.constant: Lua script code will be evaluated if it looks like a Godot script, but otherwise not loaded at all. See also [member looks_like_godot_script].
Lua script code will always be evaluated regardless of whether it looks like a Godot script or not.
Lua script code will not be loaded nor evaluated regardless of whether it looks like a Godot script or not.
